They better have an ad-free version.  I also check permissions for the apps before I download them and I prevent auto-upgrades to recheck what new permissions are being added each time.  Ripped Facebook off because of its increasing privacy intrusions, in fact.  Anyway, before you believe all those reports, find out what kind of mess those users have created by unthinkingly adding every cool app they come across.  After all, you can install and remove them once you lose interest in them and still reinstall them later.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised and ultimately defective
Reviews.Author: Barry Bayer
Reviews.Content: The device was supposed to come with Android System 4.2.2.  Alas, it had only 4.1.1.After many attempts at upgrading OTA, Google Product Supportclaimed it may have a defective boot loader (whatever that is).Asus was willing to repair it, but would take at least two weeks to do itand wouldn't pay postage to them.I elected to return the unit.  Looks like I will purchase a new Nexus 7 with considerableenhancement once available in the next couple of months.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good, AND still going strong!
Reviews.Author: Barry E. Sharrow
Reviews.Content: This is my first Android device so, I'm still learning a lot about it and cannot evaluate it's capabilities with any degree of expertise.  After a week or so, it seems to be holding up and doing what it is supposed to do and that seems to be that it keeps running.  Before my purchase, I read a lot of the "one-star" reviews and finally decided that most of the negativity was due to over expectation and stupidity rather than bad luck.  I have been waiting for my Nexus 7 to summarily quit on me but so far, it is going strong.If "battery problems" arise, I know they will be caused by the possibility of a loosened connector and can easily be repaired by opening the case with a guitar pick and correcting the defect.  Apparently, if you mishandle your Nexus 7 and knock the battery loose, it is possible to dislodge one of the battery connectors, causing it to become intermittent and/or disconnected altogether.By reading many of the "fixes" for this malady, I have come to the conclusion that one of the battery leads is a trifle short and if the battery shifts, the connector is pulled loose.  NO BIG DEAL!  My take on this is that, like all OEM's, ASUS buys their components from various souces and does final assembly at one or more of their facilities.  In all likelihood, the original design was flawless but as battery technology improved, the newer batteries became slightly smaller and the locations of the connectors changed.  Thus, the battery was held in place by some double-stick tape and one of the battery leads was just long enough to be able to do it's job.  Again, no big deal, and I figured that IF I had this problem, I'd just open that puppy with a guitar pick and take a look.I like to take stuff apart anyway and tightening connectors is just part of normal maintenance so far as I'm concerned.  If needs be, I can lengthen the offending lead, resecure the battery etc.. And then, I know how to replace the battery when it actually does poop out.In a few months, if nothing catastrophic happens, I'll add to this review and probably upgrade the rating to 5 stars.  Naturally, by that time, the new Nexus 7 equivalent will be out, with all sorts of better bells and whistles.  If I like the Android system, I will consider getting the newest hardware but I'll keep my present Nexus 7 for a back-up, knowing that I can take it apart and keep it running.Besides loading a slug of "aps," I did upgade the software to 4.2.2.1, and it was a piece of cake.  This was probably because I decided to order my Nexus 7 through Amazon, paying an extra $10, just to be sure that I got the most recent hardware issued from the factory.  I like factory upgrades and Asus is good at keeping them current.More to follow.UPDATE!:I've given it another star - for longevity, not features.My wife has not been able to kill our Nexus 7 yet.  It still takes a full charge, and has not caught fire or done any of the other scary things that the collective naysayers complain about.Maybe buying from the best source really does pay off!A word to the wise etc.:Beware of Apps bearing permissions.  Fewer is better and read those "permissions" carefully.  These "Apps" both free and costly, can really screw up your device, and your life!  The Net is a dangerous place but for the vigilant and prepared, it can be a useful adventure.  Complacency can and will "get cha"! 'nuff said.

Reviews.Title: Very good tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles Slater
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the Nexus 7 tablet, branded Google, made by Asus, 7" with 32GB storage.  I am mainly comparing this model to the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, a 7" with 8 GB storage, but with an expansion slot.  I recently acquired the Galaxy model, and reviewed and returned it.  Recent builds of the Android operating system do not make good use of storage expansion.  You may not install apps to it, and many apps which write data cannot be configured to write to it.  While you can use the storage to copy large media files, I felt that the 8 GB available for apps was too limiting.  so I returned the Galaxy and acquired the Nexus.The Nexus is a near ideal 7" tablet.  Android runs beautifully on it, with apps opening noticeably snappier than on the Galaxy.  The processor seems faster and the screen resolution is higher.  Additionally the rear of the unit, with a kind of a textured rubber is friendlier for holding the unit.  I don't want to be too disparaging of the Galaxy, as it is a strong and capable unit.  I just feel that the Nexus is better.  (As I write this, there is word of a Samsung Galaxy 3, so the market is rapidly evolving).The Nexus has the latest version of Android (Jelly Bean), and can be set to automatically update the OS and any apps in the background.  Wifi performance has been excellent.  Netflix and HBO streaming video run very well, and it is, of course, an excellent ereader, supporting the Kindle app and others.  The unit has stereo speakers, but for any serious listening, you will want to use headphones.  The audio volume through the speakers is low, and even through headphones it doesn't get really loud.  I am fine with this, and I note also that there are apps available for boosting volume.In short, everything I've thrown at the Nexus has been handled well.

Reviews.Title: Really Enjoying Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I don't own a smart phone, and never used an Android device before. I wanted to buy a small tablet, and the top 3 choices were Kindle Fire HD, iPad Mini, or Nexus 7. Cost is an important part of my decision making, so the iPad Mini was out immediately.I'm sure the Kindle Fire HD is a great product... I've seen them in action and have no doubt I would have been happy with it. However, in the end, I went with the Nexus 7 and I'm glad I did.The Android operating system was new to me, but it's so intuitive that within a few days, I felt very comfortable downloading new apps and trying out all kinds of things, from drawing and sketching to games and productivity tools. The portability and convenience of such a small device is really fun. I take it into the kitchen with me when I'm looking up recipes. Luckily, I already had some really nice Bluetooth headphones and listen to all the music I can imagine on Spotify. I've also uploaded all my music to Google Music. I've watched a couple of TV episodes I missed, and have a Netflix subscription. Also, I'm a Kindle eReader owner (older version), and find that reading my Kindle books (using the Kindle Android App) on the Nexus 7 is wonderful! It's back-lit and really easy on the eyes.I was already a moderate Google user (gmail, drive, docs, Picasa), but when you use the Nexus 7, you start to see the puzzle pieces of the world of Google fit together very nicely. I, like many Google users, have also noticed the huge amount of information Google has collected about me in order to fit me into Google World seamlessly... it's a trade-off, I guess. iPad owners have the same issue with Apple.The battery life of the Nexus 7 is incredible, and better than anticipated. I'm impressed with the overall quality and ease of use, the learning curve is not very steep.The only thing missing, of course, is a camera on the back (there is a front-facing cam for Skype, etc). I've also read many complaints of the lack of an HDMI-out port for connecting to an HDTV.For the price, I think Nexus 7 owners have a beautiful piece of technology that serves many purposes and interests... and ranks right up there with the iPad mini. Great job, Google and Asus.

Reviews.Title: I returned TWO iPad minis
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This past Christmas I bought my wife an iPad mini because she lives with her ipod touch and the mini had a larger screen (it is in fact just a large iPod touch).  When we opened gifts, she had bought me one too (I was/am an Android smart phone user).  I spent 18 hours over the course of 3 days trying to get them up and running.  It wasn't me.  Each call was "elevated" to a "senior" Apple tech rep.  One mini would not stay connected to wi fi, and the other would not accept photos from my wife's ipod to the mini.  A trip to the Apple Store (45min one way) didn't resolve either problem. I returned them both...and to their credit, there were no issues with the returns.  The wife is back with her iPod touch and I went out and bought myslef a Nexus 7 (after exhaustive research).  This thing is fast, dependable, versatile, looks great, terrific screen resoltion and a joy to work/play with.  I've had it 2 months and won't look at Apple again due to price....and their constant "updates" that inevitably cause us issues on other devices (iphone and ipod touch).  The cost difference is a no brainer ($199 if you skip Amaon's prices).  The biggest push back I get from family members with the ipad mini is the number of apps available.  Be realistic.  I'm exaggerating but if Apple has 400,000 apps and Android has 300,000 apps, who cares.  Apple is wearing off....and if costs don't come down soon, Android will eat them alive....over time.  This table is FANTASTIC and a GREAT VALUE.  But please note, I bought mine at Office Depot.  Amazon prices for this tablet are highway robbery....and I am an avid Amazon shopper but for this device they are way out of line.  Note:  I checked with Staples, Wal Mart, Office Max, Office Depot, etc.  They all have a 14 day return policy.  So if you're not sure, then buy locally for not only price but convenience...at least for this item.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet for an even better price!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that I am typically an Apple person. I am writing this review on my MacBook Air. I own an iPhone5, and have an iPad Third Generation. I bought this tablet over the iPad Mini after much contemplation. I needed a smaller tablet that is more portable for my job. I'm in retail, and frequently I need to look up products online for customers and was growing tired of having to walk to a desktop computer with the customer in tow. I was a little leery of Android from all the reports of malware that is reported on the web. However, I bought my sister a Nexus 7 for Christmas (she was VERY specific). I only handled it once, but I was impressed with the fluidity and screen resolution. After a few weeks, I asked her if she liked her tablet. She was so excited to tell me that she was very happy with the Nexus 7.This tablet is very light weight. It feels great in your hands. I do recommend getting some kind of case or shell for it because even though it is textured on the back, it does feel at times like it might slip out of your hands. Android Jelly Bean 4.2 comes standard, and my oh my have they made headway with this OS. It's fast, sleek and smooth. It opens programs rapidly and has a beautiful interface with each. I do suggest that you download Avast! mobile security. It is free, and it also happens to be the top rated tablet anti-virus/malware software currently on the market. I did heavy research before my tablet arrived. One great thing that I have noticed with Jelly Bean is that there are fewer apps that run in the background automatically as in previous versions. I still use Task Killer to shut them down to conserve battery life. Speaking of which, I have been able to get almost 7 hours out of a charge of surfing the internet, playing music, etc. The tablet comes with a free HD movie, Ice Age, and I suspect it's to show off the beautiful screen resolution. Some people think they need a 10" tablet to view movies, but I've never felt like I was squinting to watch anything.Apps. They are great. I love Google+, Pinterest, and Instagram. Gmail also runs great and has a simple yet intuitive interface. There are of course the others, such as Facebook and Twitter. I don't personally use Twitter, but I did take a peek at it, and it's quite beautiful and crisp. There a several games that render beautifully on the tablet. I also like the Evernote App, it comes in handy for work and also for my other half and I to send grocery lists to each other.Bottom line: If you want a very portable tablet that is fast, powerful and beautiful, this tablet is the one for you! I paid $270 plus a $59 two year accidental drop, spill and damage warranty from SquareTrade that guarantees my tablet repaired or replaced in five days or they'll pay me $300. I've done my research, and they are the real deal. They receive excellent reviews from all the tech websites such as CNET, Techradar, Android Central, etc. This would be a great tablet for a teenager because you wouldn't have $600 in an iPad for them to break it or loose it. You can also encrypt the tablet to protect your data if you have sensitive work information. I would recommend this to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Bad hardware quality
Reviews.Author: Erick Houli
Reviews.Content: I've had the tablet for a few weeks and found out today that the Microphone is not working, after Googling (isn't it ironic?) these Nexus 7 have been known to have this issue, I bought it through Amazon marketplace, but can't return it because of Adorama's policy.Be my guests, google for Nexus 7 microphone's issue.Other than that, I think is a nice offer for the price, but Google needs to raise their manufacturer's requirement standards, the Nexus 7 has been out for a few months and the issues should've been sorted out.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: divakar mithal
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I returned this item but not because of any deficiency. The circumstances for which I bought it changed, and instead of keeping I returned it.I have used a wide array of touch-screen technologies and tend to favor the Apple environment. I think the samsung tablets are excellent, however, and have considered shifting to them in the past. I think this 7" Nexus tablet was simply fantastic, and with the seamless google integration, was a breeze to set up.Particularly, I found the sim card functionality, minimal-lag scrolling and google apps to be very useful. I had no problems at all. We had a novice adult touch screen user using it within an hour of opening the box.I used a pre-paid sim w/ 3g service and that service was up and running without a hitch.This product is highly recommended. The only downside that I can see is that has a little glare on the screen. A matte screen protector could help with that, but it's not necessary.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Nadine Graham
Reviews.Content: In love with this tablet, so happy i purchase for my personal use. The quality is excellent. Will purchase the keyboard to go with it

Reviews.Title: Awesome! In love with this device!!
Reviews.Author: Cynstrends
Reviews.Content: I absoluely love this device! It is exactly what I was looking for. It has the versatility I needed in a netbook and am thrilled to find something so user friendly and not have to go with an iPad. The size is great, slips conveniently in my purse, so I take it everywhere. The speaker is great. I can set this baby up in my living room, click on my favorite tunes and hear it all over the house. In fact I am considering seriuosly buying a second one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy!
Reviews.Author: Latanya R Gathers
Reviews.Content: I love my google Nexus 7!  It is totally what everyone says it is!  Fast, accurate, and so much more!.  The shipping was super fast too. Ordered on fri and package was on doorstep on Monday!  If you don't have this, go out and pick this up! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Great deal at $149!
Reviews.Author: kavlito
Reviews.Content: I really needed a replacement tablet due to the nature of my PCTuneUpGuy business, working in the field and taking lots of notes.  I use Evernote for all my client work documentation and I use Android's MobileBiz Pro for billing.  This is the perfect form factor for being mobile, and especially with the Thumb Keyboard 4 app, it's very easy for me to take notes on.I was looking at Samsung Tab 3 7, but the specs on this were better, especially 32GB.  It automatically updated through 2 updates to Android 4.4 Kit Kat.  My only disappointment is that the bluetooth does not connect to my Sony BM10.  Don't know whose fault it is.The thinness, the rubber back, the minimalistic design all work great for me.  I added a Zagg invisibleSHIELD screen protector which works great because it has a rubbery feel to it.  Between the rubberized back of the tablet and the screen protector, it makes it so much easier to handle without it feeling like it is going to slip out of my hands.  I returned a Lenovo Mix 2 10 because it was so slippery and just a disaster waiting to happen.For anybody who needs an inexpensive, quality tablet... Grab em while you can!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it
Reviews.Author: Ian Thomas Murphy
Reviews.Content: Nice and lightweight, the battery also lasts a long time which I was pleasantly surprised. I was skeptical about getting a tablet at first but I love this thing, it's great to watch in bed or rest somewhere in the car while parked somewhere.Another thing about this tablet is that it's easy to use and is super responsive and quick, I couldn't really ask for more in a tablet. All in all there isn't anything wrong with this tablet that I can think of, but having a mini HDMI port would make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: d
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this tablet.  I only had it a month and my son dropped it.  It didn't shatter or crack, but a crucial spot on the screen went unresponsive.I couldn't use it that way, so I went and got a 2nd gen, WiFi only one.  I will say the performance is similar enough between the 1st and 2nd gen that you are totally OK buying the 1st gen. Just don't drop it, mine was in a case and still messed up. :-)

Reviews.Title: Loving it
Reviews.Author: cbob
Reviews.Content: Got hooked up with carrier for the 4g capabilities.  Does great.  Super fast.  Still trying to learn how to take full advantage of all the features.  But, I think it will work out.

Reviews.Title: Sure like this tablet
Reviews.Author: Robert L Burkey
Reviews.Content: This tablet is very nice.  It has all the things I want/need to do.  I would recommend this Nexus 7 to anyone lookig for a full funtion tablet.

Reviews.Title: Very nice.
Reviews.Author: Sharon A. Schalow
Reviews.Content: It has been a lot of fun. It is perfect for what I wanted it for. Gets a little warm, but not to bad. .

Reviews.Title: Its perfect
Reviews.Author: marc heys
Reviews.Content: This version of the Nexus might be 2 years old, but it runs and keeps up with all but the fastest Android devices out currently. Plus I had it rooted and running Cyanogenmod within and hour of opening the box. A huge perk of owning a nexus device.

Reviews.Title: that is the tablet to buy
Reviews.Author: Halil Kukner
Reviews.Content: now there is 2013 model of nexus 7, hence 2012 model was cheaper. we were between 2013 and 2012 models, but then just bought the 2012 model. it is totally awesome & satisfactory  after our smartphones. these tablet are optimized by google chrome provides you a smooth surfing & facebook experience. Moreover, screen quality is really good. images, videos, etc...sound qualtiy is good, too.only thing is there is one front cam, but there isn't any back cam.but of course, tablets are not for photo shooting purpose. since we carry our camera and smartphones with as, this is totally not an issue to mention.the cpu performance is reallly cool. you can open pdf, excel, etc... you can watch HD videos, play games.I am really happy and glad for buying this nexus 7. especially 2012 model is way cheaper than 2013 version.

Reviews.Title: For primary use as GPS/Video Screen
Reviews.Author: APN
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome portable device. I got this during the thanksgiving sale and its going strong even now after continuous use as a GPS for my car [with Copilot offline maps]. The screen isn't as bright and clear as an iPad but it serves the purpose. The speakers are optimal with no high performance features. The graphics is a bit laggy when you scroll fast through web pages or when you start playing Asphalt 8. But when i'm driving with GPS on or listening to music or when i'm streaming HD content through Netflix this tablet performs flawlessly. Its a bit battery hungry when you use GPS but this can be avoided by having an in-car charger for the nexus. Overall for a hundred bucks this is a very worthwhile tablet for outdoor carefree use!

Reviews.Title: excelent  buy
Reviews.Author: RONNY REYES
Reviews.Content: This has been the best buy for my boy 05-year-old gamer. I can now have my laptop back! We have no complaints

Reviews.Title: Best buy
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J Morefield
Reviews.Content: This has been the best buy for my 11-year-old gamer. I can now have my laptop back! We have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. My son has one and he convinced me to get one and I am so glad I did. It does everything I need it to and more.

Reviews.Title: lOvE IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Renai Breisinger
Reviews.Content: Love love love this tablet!!!  So worth the money!  I kept buying cheaper tablets and would only last a week or two!  This tablet was about mid scale and works just as well as my kindle. Very comparable to the kindle!

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had to go online and gather more info to get it to work  and look the way I wanted. But it works fine for what I need it to do, mainly browse and read both kindle and and nook books. Works great.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Ian Feinleib "Ian F."
Reviews.Content: Fantastic piece of hardware. Upgraded to KitKat flawlessly. However, KitKat does not allow messaging.  If this a consideration, think twice before installing KitKat. Therefore, 4 stars to Google, 5 stars to ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: David G. Varghese
Reviews.Content: I think, especially for the price, this is the best tablet out on the market today. ASUS once again delivers an excellent, sturdy product. Would definitely recommend this product (but this is the older version, so you may want to take a look at the newer model).

Reviews.Title: Decent tablet.
Reviews.Author: Courtnichole
Reviews.Content: I have had no problems with this tablet. I would recommend this tablet to any one who wants a tablet.

Reviews.Title: one sweet device!
Reviews.Author: the_red_blue_blur
Reviews.Content: I purchased this device because my sister has have one for couple years and loves hers so I decided I want to get one. I have not been disappointed one bit. From all the apps I can Install to all my bluetooth devices I have connected to it. I can connect a printer to an imprint anything I want from the device. it is simply incredible. I have no complaints whatsoever in any manner with this and I would recommend this item to anyone who would like a good 7 inch tablet by their side. And are all kinds of new games out like deer hunter 2014, Iron Man 3, Real Racing 3 and a classic plants vs zombies 2. But is on one way you'll know if you like It. Try It out!!

Reviews.Title: Very Tablet. Much Usability. Wow.
Reviews.Author: Jason W. Bowden
Reviews.Content: I don't think ASUS is even aware of how usable and fun their simple tablet design is. Homework gets done faster thanks to this little thing being mounted beside my laptop, and I can use it for Google Hangouts while collaborating on college assignments and mobile game development. How I managed without this handy little thing is a mystery worth writing a novel about.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet! Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with my Nexus 7. It does almost every thing I want in a tablet. The one thing is is missing is a camera on the back side. It has a front-facing camera, but none on the other side. This might have been covered in the specs when buying the device, but I did not notice it. Again, still a great and affordable device. Really great for surfing the web when I want something meatier than my phone, but not as big as my laptop.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: diligent
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my 8 year-old so he would stop playing with my smart phone.  He loves it. The picture quality is great. The wi-fi connection a lot better than my nook color.  He watches netflix on it all of the time, so I figure the sound and speed is pretty good as well.  He has had it for one month and so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jorge S.
Reviews.Content: The only thing Asus and Google missed in this crear tableta os the SD card slot, besides that, I hace nmo complains...

Reviews.Title: boots up slow
Reviews.Author: S. gill "Lana"
Reviews.Content: Good product but it boots up rather slowly, I have 3 tablets (ASUS, Samsung, and Amazon Kindle {2nd gen}) this tablet is the most disappointing. Which i guess I shouldn't be surprised it is an Asus product. I made the mistake of buying one of their laptops. Suffice to say it does do what it's supposed to, when it isn't freezing or taking its sweet time. The touchscreen is very responsive, actually its too sensitive. The thing turns off for no reason. I would definitely not recommend the 2012 version.

Reviews.Title: 32GB Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: menace_shoes
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. I have the earlier version that I bought in July (slightly smaller and lighter in weight), and this one I bought for my boyfriend's Christmas gift. Colors are great, apps are unlimited, and it's exactly what he needed.My ONLY drawback, for me, would be that it's a little too heavy to read from comfortably, but he likes the solid feel of the weight.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: shas
Reviews.Content: tab came on time, usb cable had a little knick on it. but that didnt impede its functionality... tab works great, updates like a charm.. just missing the back cam, BUT.. still a great tab

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Katerina
Reviews.Content: I like it so much. Use it with WiFi now. Didn't get simcard yet but I'm sure it will be great as well. Not so big Nd not so small. Can take it anywhere with u. Easy to work with even if you new in it. Camera is OK. Not for professional users of course but enough to take good pictures right away

Reviews.Title: Worked for five minutes
Reviews.Author: Aaron Maldonado
Reviews.Content: It came working out of the Box.Fast forward three months and the product wont keep a charge for more than 3 hours, the mini USB slot is flimsy, and it takes about ten hours to actually charge.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Buschchris1
Reviews.Content: Best value for the money. Has enough power to run games and do everything on the web. Has long battery life and works great for movies, netflix, as an E reader and music storage. Its slim and simple. Way better price and more power than the Kindle Fire. Dont waste money on an IPad that limits you and you have to pay for apps. This does everything and is the perfect size to fit in a back jean pocket. The next generation of this is even better.

Reviews.Title: great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Julie Becker
Reviews.Content: For the price, this tablet really does the trick.  I don't get what is so much better about the ipad mini that it would cost several times what this costs (since I primarily use it with wireless anyhow, and can use my iphone for gps and the like). I originally bought it to use on a vacation with the idea of giving it to one of the kids once the new ipad mini comes out, but I'm now thinking I'll just keep this because it's everything I need. I haven't tried reading books on it yet (kept my e-ink kindle just in case), but love having it in bed at night to catch up on email and watch movies. I've stopped using my TV!  The only issue I'm having, hence the 4 star, is that the charging cord doesn't seem to sit well in the device. It's a little hard to get in, and it doesn't seem to fit in tightly.  PS - I understand the ipad has longer battery life, but this isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: This version is the OLD Nexus 7 FIRST GENERATION
Reviews.Author: camisdad "camisdad"
Reviews.Content: Great product, but be aware that this is the first generation product, not the Nexus 7 2nd Gen with LTE.I can find the Nexus 7 2nd Gen without LTE on Amazon here: Google Nexus 7 Tablet (7-Inch, 32GB, Black) by ASUS (2013), but I cannot find the Nexus 7 2nd Gen with LTE on Amazon, it looks like you have to go to Google Play for it.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Charles John
Reviews.Content: Really great tablet no issues so far! It's easy to use and starts up in a few seconds. Runs everything I can think of and never slows down.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 GREAT TABLET
Reviews.Author: Clifford Law
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is awesome! Great bang for your buck.  It blows tablets that are three times the price out of the water!!

Reviews.Title: Battery issues marred the experience
Reviews.Author: AlanH
Reviews.Content: Great seller, great product and service; but I am having battery problems just weeks into owning the item, and I use it lightly.  Can't day for certain it was a seller issue, but not happy, as it makes the device have limited usage for me.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7" tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles Schwab
Reviews.Content: Have had this tablet for over a month and love it. I use every day to do genealogy and play games.The only thing I don't like about it is the camera lens is in the front of tablet instead of the back. Makes taking pics awkward with trying to keep yourself out of the pic.  Need the camera lens on the back side of the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Gave it as a well-received gift
Reviews.Author: William R. Pratt "Bill Pratt"
Reviews.Content: I sent one to my niece-in-law and she says she absolutely loves it. Now my nephew wants one! Hang on, pal, Christmas is coming!

Reviews.Title: Great Devise
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I picked this up. It's been everything I wanted in a tablet and performed without error or problem.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Vera Larina
Reviews.Content: I was looking on Amazon for to buy a tablet and finally found this one. Then I've read about this gadget and took  my brother's opinion and got it. Indeed this one is working very good.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Very Happy with the whole experience with Amazon and the tablet is GREAT! Purchase was easy, The use of gift card was simple and everything came on time and as expected

Reviews.Title: Works great, just wish I had waited 3 months for the new version.
Reviews.Author: Wayne Jines
Reviews.Content: Using it for the Kindle app, really like it. Comes in handy to watch movies I compress as mp4s as well. I didn't realize there was a new one coming out about 3 months after getting this one with the extra camera, but live and learn right?

Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Really cool tablet. I've had it for a couple months now and had no issues. My whole family wants one now, even though they already have tablets. It's extremely portable and the perfect size. Gaming is awesome and watching movies is a similar experience. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: anthony gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Anthony Gonzalez  My girlfriend recently bought me the Google Nexus 7. I found this tablet very useful for music and games. The tablet fits my needs due to its 32 gigabyte hard drive it stores all my music and I still have 14 gigabytes left of free space. I also find it useful when I am expecting an important email: I could just turn it on and recent emails show on the main screen. The tablet is like a small TV in the palm of your hands. It's small enough to fit in your pocket. Its light and the back is strangely smooth but contains small dots and looks like a carbon fiber hood. It also has Google Nexus and Asus engraved in the back. I would have found it more satisfying if it had camera in the back. Since I find the front view camera useless. I recommend this tablet its lighting fast compatible with WI-FI and only for 249 a 32 gig its worth the price compared to other tablets.  I prefer having a Google Nexus 7 over the I pad mini because I can use it more freely. Such as the music and the apps. In the android market there is more of a variety to choose from than the ios7. In the Ipad mini you have to buy most of your music from the app store and in the Google Nexus 7 you could just download apps to do it for you instead of paying for your entertainment. I love the fact how the Google Nexus 7 you can multitask and the Ipad mini you cant. Therefore the Google Nexus 7 allows much more freedom in customizing the look and feel of your tablet. They both have parental control features the Ipad mini menu is very limited you will only find Safari, Camera, FaceTime, iTunes, iBookstore, Twitter, Facebook and Siri. Also You can't create separate profiles so if you share your device with your children you have to go in and switch the restrictions on and off each time you hand them the device. The google nexus 7 you can restrict the type of content you want to block such as explicit movies/videos, TV shows, apps and music. Also in the Google Nexus 7 you can have a profile for each member of the family makes sharing a tablet so much easier. The Google nexus 7 overall is a great tablet for all type of use.  The Google Nexus 7 max screen resolution is 1280x800 pixels. The size of the screen is 7 inches. It contains 1 Lithium ion battery that is required and it's already included. The Average battery for this tablet is about 9.5 hours. The tablet has only one camera which is found in the front and it has 1.2 megapixels. The processor that the tablet uses is the tegra 3 quad-core processor. It also contains Gps so you can Google map any address. It contains Bluetooth to send music, make calls ect. Powered by android. i recommend this tablet to anyone because its easy to use and reliable and economical and fits anyones needs. This is what makes this Google Nexus 7 the best in the market and my #1 choice.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: natasha
Reviews.Content: Please don't buy this tablet it blanks out for no reason at all, for at least 2 days at a time from the first couple of days within delivery. I am not happy with this at all.

Reviews.Title: Love the Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Hoosiermama "Mary Loveless"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my grandson. When it came, it was a 16 gig instead of a 32 gig, but Amazon adjusted the price for me. I'm still happy with it, as I wanted something to put some movies on, and to allow him to play some educational games. The N7 is by far the best 7" tablet out there. Even though this is a 2012, and not the 2013, it's still a great tablet.The unit didn't arrive in the original N7 box, but it was packaged well, and worked flawlessly as soon as I charged it up. I got it for a good price, so I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the money - Quality Machine
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gunther "musac man"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the original Nexus 7, 32gb. I have had my Nexus 7 for about 9 months and life has not been easy for the poor machine. I have a 5 year old who loves to play games on it and has been known to drop it, I have dropped it myself a few times, it gets carried in a messenger bag 4 miles every day while I walk the bumpy streets and get jostled in the subway, and I even left it outside on the top of the car (who put it on top of the car is still up for debate) for 3 days which included being driven around for miles on bumpy streets and getting rained on. Thankfully I have a cheap case which seems to do a decent job protecting the device (there was moisture sitting on the machine itself after being left outside for a few days). The Nexus 7 keeps ticking. It keeps providing hours of enjoyment watching movies I have loaded onto the hard drive, as well as through Netflix,and provides plenty of music and light gaming for the families enjoyment. I also use it to access email, surf the internet, read books, and plenty of other things. The device has slowed down since I originally received it, but not horribly noticeably. It still runs well with most thing I use it for and I have had no serious issues, never lost data, never had it malfunction, and never needed it serviced. It is certainly worth the cheap price it's offered at. I hear the new Nexus models are faster, lighter, and better over all , so I may need to pick up another one for the family.As for battery life, mine seems to take a while to charge, however, once charge it holds it's charge for a LONG time. I am not kidding when I say that it was used almost non-stop during a 7+ hour car ride with video or gaming, and never once did we need to plug it in (it has done this trip several times).

Reviews.Title: ASUS Nexus 7 (7-Inch, 32GB) Tablet (2012)
Reviews.Author: iQ7
Reviews.Content: Want to buy the new version nexus 7,found cheaper price for the older version.Fast CPU and everything run smooth.Thanks to amazon i have much choice and save time and money.

Reviews.Title: Simply best android tablet
Reviews.Author: Goh Chee Kiong
Reviews.Content: If you want an android tablet without any additional apps from the manufacturer, get Nexus. Interface is never so much smoother.

Reviews.Title: Love It...
Reviews.Author: Thomas G. Berger "TommyB78"
Reviews.Content: User friendly, fast, sleek and more memory too shake a stick it. I can't stop complimenting my Nexus. We have a Kindle Fire and an Ipad, but I love the Nexus it's a perfect tablet match for me. >.<

Reviews.Title: Way better than my thousand dollar ITurd...
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift for someone and this thing is great.  It does way more that my IPad and was a fraction of the price!!!Nice crisp screen and wonderful quality!!!

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: HAMEED YOUSEF M. TILEB
Reviews.Content: i love it the ASUS Nexus 7 (7-Inch, 32GB) Tablet .i have very very good time and its very nice tablet for use in you home and work

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool tablet
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful and efficient tablet, with stock Android OS. It's also supposed to be updated to Android version 4.3 soon.

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: Dave Junia Lum
Reviews.Content: A great tablet that offers good value for money. Long battery life and a great price thanks to the new Nexus.

Reviews.Title: Freaking Awesome!!! No joke.. lol
Reviews.Author: Ruthie
Reviews.Content: I actually love this tablet!! I like the option of having more than one account. I love how it's a lightweight and 32GB for under $200!! I bought this almost a year ago...in November 2012. Still works amazing and never had to take it back to be fixed or updated. It's actually really cool! Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: It definitely had its issues but it was fun.
Reviews.Content: I got the Nexus 7 a year ago and for the first few months it worked great but then one day I went to turn it on and got a blackish static screen. I managed to get it to turn on long enough to restore it to factory settings. After that it worked for a while. About a 2 months or so ago I realized that every time I shut down my tablet it would not power up again because it would have no battery (It didn't matter that I would shut it down with 100% battery). This was annoying but I was able to deal with it. A month ago while we were on vacation I dropped my tablet on the concrete accidently. That night I played with my tablet and it worked fine. The next day when I got my tablet out it had a crack running along the front of the screen and the bottom half of the screen would not respond to touch. After seeing that it would cost 80-90 dollars to replace the screen and lcd I decided that it wasn't worth it. I would replace my tablet if I had the money because I know that it was probably my fault that it broke. Even though it had its issues I would happily get another Nexus 7 if I had the money because when my tablet was working I had a great time with it. It had good battery life, a bright screen, responded well to touch, and handled nicely. Also  early on,for no apparent reason my power cord  broke. I would still recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet
Reviews.Author: Kadzhibongo "Vsevolod"
Reviews.Content: It is amazing. Excellent tablet for a reasonable price. The higher resolution HD screen is great for reading and watching videos. Jelly Bean (4.1) is really good. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: top class tablet
Reviews.Author: Yiannis Socratous
Reviews.Content: The price is very good compared to other tablets. Size is excellent for its use, browsing, email, social networking and reading. For me this is not a replacement for my laptop but more of a supplement. Battery lasts very long. The cellular is a plus since I can use it when no WiFi, but keep an eye on your data plan, it uses more mbits than cellphone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: Gunnarman
Reviews.Content: I bought this recently and I am completely satisfied with it. The HD screen is gorgeous and I was amazed at how slick it moves on your fingertips. I thought the design looked boring when looking at it online but I think it looks great in person. The price is reasonable and I found reading to be very easy wit the ability to edit pages in an eBook and zoom in on text while using Google chrome. Chrome is also fantastic; it works just as well as it does on PCs. The only thing that bugs me a little is the fact that there's only one camera. Taking pictures of anything but yourself is difficult because of this. I seriously don't think its a big deal though. I'm just happy to have a camera.Overall, this is a beautiful device and everything about it satisfying to me. The screen is amazing, as well as the experience of watching shows and movies. The reading is great, the sound quality is great too. The apps are nice too. Basically everything is as it should be. I recommend it if you have the cash.

Reviews.Title: Nothing to dislike about.
Reviews.Author: Otulea T.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it. Very fast and a lot of memory at 32g is fantastic. It has all of what I need from a mini tablet. An improved camera and back - mounted instead would be nice. But that would drive up the price on it.

Reviews.Title: love it and no problems so far
Reviews.Author: Goings
Reviews.Content: The Asus Nexus 7 is a great, convenient tablet. I have had no problems with it so far. The size makes it easy to carry around or fit in a pocket. It also fits nicely in one hand for use. The screen is crisp and clear. The battery life is good; I can get about 2 days of use before recharging. The app store is very versatile and offers a wide range of apps.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: Have a few issues, the speakers are weak hard to listen to movies or games . other than that very fast tablet and its just what my gf wanted

Reviews.Title: Love this thing.
Reviews.Author: stony
Reviews.Content: My first tablet and I wasn't sure if I would like the size.  Now I rarely use my laptop, the Nexus is all I need.

Reviews.Title: The Nexus is a great tool and source of entertainment
Reviews.Author: Sandra P. Lachs "HR maven"
Reviews.Content: It has so much capability and the resolution is excellent.  I would highly recommend to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet, Better and cheaper than iPad mini
Reviews.Author: Gun_Monkey
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is my personal favorite in the realm of tablets of it size. Based on objectively comparable features, it is better generally better than the iPad mini, other than in the case of cameras, as the Nexus 7 has no rear camera to take pictures. This tablet is also a bit smaller than the iPad mini, making it just the right size to fit in a cargo pants pocket. The Android operating system, however, is more compatible with other devices than iOS, making it easier to import pictures and other files to the device. The Android operating system also allows for much more personalization than iOS. The Nexus 7's powerful hardware, crystal clear display, and exterior construction also set it above most competitors of its approximate size including the iPad mini. Surprisingly, one of my favorite features is the backplaye, which is plastic, but has a nice grippy, anti-slip texture that contributes to how perfectly the Nexus 7 fits perfectly in one hand.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Máté B.
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tablet for who don't want to carry big, heavy devices. The navigation in the menu is very smooth, good display, and you always get the newest android when it released.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Onir Pernia "Onir Pernia"
Reviews.Content: I honestly recommend this tablet to anyone.PROS:- It's fairly easy to use.- It looks and feels great on your hands.- I personally love the fact that it is in the 7 inches form factor.- The back has some sort of texture that adds a sufficient amount of grip to the device.- Runs pretty fast and has astonishing graphics.CONS:- You have to manually add VPNs for abroad use.- No default tethering option.- No cellphone (unlike most samsung tablets).- No whatsapp - like apps.All the cons have some ways around them, but you are required some technical knowledge. Most of the stuff can be found on xda forums though.

Reviews.Title: What I expected and arrived in time. Thank you!
Reviews.Author: Bea Langsdorf
Reviews.Content: I've ordered this product as a raffle prize for a trade show.  The Nexus 7 had the Tegra 3 NVIDIA chip inside that makes all video images and gaming an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET AT A GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: I have been using it for a month for working and playing and works perfectly.Highly recommended for all purpose

Reviews.Title: Awesome Nexus 7 tablet!
Reviews.Author: W. Uncapher
Reviews.Content: I'm an even bigger fan of Google after buying this Nexus 7 tablet. Love the ease of use, and the customizing ability. I love the new Android O.S. Jellybean 4.2. It's very smooth operating. I'm also a fan of Asus for their excellent build quality of the Nexus 7. It definitely  appears that Google and Asus collaborated very closely on this tablet. I was concerned about the tablet. Because it's made by Asus. And my past experience with their customer service, leaves little to be desired! But, after doing research, I came to realize that the support of this tablet software is all Google. Asus is just the hardware. Since Asus builds quality products in general, this should not be an issue. I was also pleased to learn that Google engineers much of it's Android O.S. in my hometown. Here in Pittsburgh! Love supporting American jobs, especially good paying ones. The screen resolution is great. Which is made with Corning glass. Another U.S. based company A.K.A. Corning, NY! It's also very easy to read. The Nexus 7 connected to my wi-fi effortlessly. And my bluetooth keyboard also works very well with it. Love being able to speak to the Nexus 7 and it finds what I want. And it understands me every time. Surfing the net or reading e-mail is terrific. Also great for Facebook and YouTube. Lots of great apps available, including many games. Would have liked a rear facing camera. But, not a deal breaker! I like all my memories to be saved on my Sony Cyber Shot digital camera anyway. You still can't beat a good digital camera for photos. The tablet is also the perfect size. Fits in your hand perfectly, not too big or small. Making it a great portable mini p.c. I feel this is by far the best value for the money in a tablet. With 32 GB of memory, H.D. screen, Android O.S. and a quad core processor. You can hardly go wrong. And great Google support to boot. Google is committed to constantly improving their Android O.S. A big plus!

Reviews.Title: defective and asus won't repair under warranty
Reviews.Author: jane eyre
Reviews.Content: Updated 7/11/2013 - I returned my tablet for RMA due to the screen flicker problem after much reluctance due to the negative experience other people had with asus RMA process.  The first time I sent the tablet in, it was acknowledged there was an issue.  However, a part unrelated to the screen flicker issue was replaced.  In addition, my tablet was restored to factory settings losing all my apps.  When I got the tablet back, I tried it in the same conditions where I was having the issue and the screen flickering was still there.  I sent it back a second time and my husband and I got two customer service agents involved this time.  It was acknowledged that the first person who processed our RMA did not detail the issue in their system.  It was also acknowledged the proper fix for this issue is replacing the display cable (although multiple online reports do mention that the screen also needs to be replaced to provide a permanent fix) and that the battery cable on my device (not related to the screen flicker issue at all) was replaced last time.  They are also claiming they can't replicate the issue and have eluded to the fact they will not fix the tablet unless they can.  A few things with that - there is no way for me to know if they are testing the tablet in the same conditions that I commonly use the tablet.  I have detailed the room conditions as well as the internet conditions including internet download speeds for the agents.  My suspicion is they are testing the tablet with much better wifi signal than my house ever gets and in rooms with overhead lighting or near darkness.  The screen flicker is most known to present itself in areas of low light.  I use my tablet in a room with a bedside lamp that has a 60 watt bulb and that is when I notice the issue the most.  In addition, my gut feeling is that webpages at my house take a lot longer to load than they do in their corporate environment and thus they aren't able to notice the issue as prominently as you can in my home.So, in summary, even though it was noted that my tablet had an issue the first time I returned it and it was noted that a repair unrelated to the issue I complained about was made it does not look like the proper repair is going to be made.  I've wasted a lot of time and money on the defective nexus 7 and I do not recommend that anyone else do the same.I love my Nexus 7 tablet except mine has one flaw which has lead to it being sent back for warranty repair.  In low light the screen flickers with or without wifi.  I have read elsewhere that keeping the brightness over 30% helps this issue but that is just too bright for me.  I called Asus and they wanted to test it so it was sent back under warranty.  The tech I spoke with over the phone said that usually reloading the software fixes it and if not then a screen replacement will fix it.Other than that, this is an awesome tablet.  It is amazingly portable, so light weight and little but still powerful.  I would recommend the 32GB one over the smaller one because the price difference isn't really that significant and you can store more music on the larger one.  The screen keyboard is quite comfortable and responsive and the battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: better than kindle
Reviews.Author: molly
Reviews.Content: i recently purchased a kindle fire hd, the operating system is confusing and not very user friendly; i exchanged it for the nexus 7 its great, u like to personalize this is the tablet for you.

Reviews.Title: As good as it gets
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a substitution for an ipad.  After a few months of using it, I am sure I will never buy an ipad for me again.

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Frank "newcanon"
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Asus Nexus 1B32 Seven Inch Tablet 32gb version.  I really like mine. I does everything I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: very good value
Reviews.Author: edward gann
Reviews.Content: Have no complaints very satisfied does everything and more that you could want no need to buy an reader with this

Reviews.Title: Thanks Asus....great job!
Reviews.Author: kitty_kat
Reviews.Content: The front facing camera should be at least 4mp as it doesn't have a camera at the back.Other than that, the quality and features of the device are great. I am so in love with this tablet, I could marry it in the morning! Just kidding hubby lol

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet, easily out performs all other Android tablets
Reviews.Author: Zach Brown
Reviews.Content: The Google/Asus Nexus 7 tablet is a beautiful work of art. Everything about it is nearly perfect.This is my first tablet, and I have to say I'm slightly addicted. With all of Google's premium features right at my fingertips, the Nexus 7 is incredibly diverse for its price. I use this tablet for nearly everything: GPS while I'm biking, note-taking, music and videos, etc.The app store is huge, providing an enormous array of apps. And now, with Google Play allowing the uploading of your own books, music, videos, and documents, this tablet can be used for nearly everything. I also use it as my digital wallet, utilizing the Google Wallet NFC features.Though nearly every aspect of the tablet is amazing, I recommend that anyone buy a security app so you can find it if lost or stolen. After that, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect.
Reviews.Author: Daniel V
Reviews.Content: Other than the ergonomics of the on/off button, this tablet is just about perfect. I can't think of one thing wrong with it. I'm sure there will be other better tablets in the future, but for now I'm thrilled that I chose this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Android I am back
Reviews.Author: Lea Hayes
Reviews.Content: I left Android and listened to the iHype. I am back and once my contract is over on my phone I am going back to Android. This product is easy to use, start up was quick and painless. So easy to connect to the Internet it is ridiculous. I LOVE MY NEXUS 7!!!!

Reviews.Title: Best 4G Tablet
Reviews.Author: Lucinda O.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet. I can do literaly everything on it, and it's just the right size, not too small, not too big for travel.

Reviews.Title: Best recent purchase
Reviews.Author: Skylar
Reviews.Content: This tablet really is the pinnacle of Android tablets. Not because of power or flair, but because it's well supported due to being google's own tablet.Android was long shunned because of poor performance and lack of the variety of apps that Apple is able to provide on its own app store. I'd have to say after using it for a few days that the app store is no big deal. Not even a factor in the decision any more.Given that, this tablet does have its advantages over the more expensive Apple counterparts. These include the ability to customize the way it looks (without rooting). This can of course be done on Apple devices via jailbreaking, but I never recommend hacking a device unless you're completely dissatisfied with it. If you want more of an apple themed lock screen, there are some downloadable from the google play store. If want a live wallpaper of swimming koi that you can scare away with the flick of a finger, then you can have it. Overall I think the aesthetics of more recent android versions are better than many iOS features these days.Pros:-Approx. 6 hours battery life on non demanding games-One of the cheapest tablets on the market!-32GB space. I have over 2300 songs on it and there's plenty of space for all the games and videos I want-Great Wi-Fi range. I've seen this one mentioned before and it holds true with my Wi-Fi-Small enough for comfort, large enough for decent viewingCons:-Lower resolution than the full sized iPad. This isn't really an issue that I've found comes up, but there you have it. (still beats the more expensive iPad mini by a fair margin)-Low volume. I've found that a lot of my music isn't as loud as I'd like (probably too loud honestly). This hasn't really been an issue, but something I'm nit picky about because I'm an audiophile sometimes.Well there you have it. If you want to save some cash and get basically every feature you could find on the iPad mini, then get the nexus 7. I do have to make note of the potential upcoming reveal of the "nexus 2" though. If it starts in the same price ranges, then I would definitely wait ad buy one of those.

Reviews.Title: best 7 inch tablet so far
Reviews.Author: Pedro Gallegos
Reviews.Content: Ready out of the box, beautiful screen and core performance, battery lasts about 10 hours and takes about 2 to 3 to charge. Front camera works well for video calls. But the tegra3 stands out with impressive graphics and performance. Got nexus 7's dock and you can get pretty good sound out of the 4 pin connector

Reviews.Title: Satisfied!!
Reviews.Author: Seye Popoola
Reviews.Content: The product was delivered in good time. This is the 3G version. Only issue was that I did not know beforehand that it uses a micro-sim and not the regular one. Haven't used it for so long but enjoying it so far, definitely probably the best tablet in its size category.

Reviews.Title: Pure android
Reviews.Author: Kalpesh Patel
Reviews.Content: The best part about this is the support from Google. All the latest updates would be pushed to this device first.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Aljareda Lee
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with a tablet, but I am a well experienced PC user.  This table was so easy to use and meets all of my requirements.

Reviews.Title: SO AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Ronnie J. Osburn
Reviews.Content: Screen looks amazing, the pure android experience is great. Android has really matured as an mobile OS and this device allows it to shine. The only knock against it is the lack of LTE, but AT&Ts; 3g is more than usuable in southern California.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 4G is value for money
Reviews.Author: Sreekumar K.S
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing Tab from Asus and Google. All the features are worth the money. HSPA+ (3G+)supported, so u r online while moving. The only thing can go against this is lack of calling facility. But I believe with the VOIP technology we can over come that. Graphics quality and multiprocess with its 1.2 Quad core Processor has amazing quality with out any delay or hangs. I would recommend this to who all looking of an amazing 7" Tab

Reviews.Title: nexus 7 32gb 3g
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet nexus 7 32gb 3g through amazon website and I am thrilled about it.It is made in superb quality, very stylish, the product was as described in the ad, and the vendor fulfilled 100% the delivery on time.very recommendable for next time.

Reviews.Title: best tablet option for android users
Reviews.Author: N. Joyce
Reviews.Content: I was able to setup the tablet in a few hours downloading all of already purchased and downloaded Google apps.  Battery life is great. size is great for reading or games.  We also bought a case that allows it to stand up in its one.  Great for videos or movies.  You have access to Google and Amazon stores.Great tablet.  Check out comparisons of nexus, kindles and iPads.  I am not an i anything so didn't compare the iPad :when making my decision.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative to laptops
Reviews.Author: scott482002
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Kindle tablets as gifts and decided I'd like to try one.  I chose the Nexus 7 because of the Android OS.  As soon as I logged in to my Google account, all of the Google based info was transferred to the tablet.  I was thinking I would spend hours manually entering my info.  It's fun and flexible.  I decided to go with the WiFi only because I primarily use it at home.  I also switched to an Android based phone and now it's linked to my tablet as well as my computer.  Last, there are hundreds of apps to choose from and you can download them from your computer directly to my tablet and phone.

Reviews.Title: Great for travel
Reviews.Author: L. Rodrigues "Lu Rod"
Reviews.Content: Small size, very portable.This is my first such device. I would have given this a 5-star if they'd been clearer about how to use and set up the programs. Apps that you'd think were included, like the camera, had to be searched and downloaded. All in all I'm very happy with this device.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: james ashleigh
Reviews.Content: really like the nexus, lovely screen, good build quality, the gsm option makes it  a truly mobile device. the processer is fast and jelly bean is clearly the best android yet. on the down side, the battery could be better with about 6-7 hours of use. the lack of expandable memory and no HDMI are also both dissapointing omissions from what is otherwise a very capable little tablet at a great price.

Reviews.Title: The best tablet
Reviews.Author: Fernando Gabriel Muñoz Mena
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with the features of the tablet, I like the product and  I am thrilled with the features of the tablet

Reviews.Title: Great smaller tablet.
Reviews.Author: Raymond Lancione
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome and comes packed with features for the price.Access to the great Android Google Play market.  You can enjoy almost all the apps you enjoy on your Android phone.  From Nest's mobile thermostats, to Minecraft, to Facebook.The device is super fast with it's qaud-core processor.  It's also great with battery life.The only problem is the brightness is slightly dull compared to other tablets.  It's harder to see outside.  It also does not have expandible memory so you'll be stuck at 32GB but I haven't ran into any storage problems.  I paired this with a Bluetooth keyboard that also acts as a case.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: candy18 "candy"
Reviews.Content: The nexus 7 tablet is a good tablet for its price. i would suggest that the tablet came with a guide to tell people what to do if their tablet powers of.the first time it happened to me i was extremely upset i wanted to return it right away but then i tried holding the power button for a minute and it turned on this usually happens when the tablet is out of charge or if you press power off on  your tablet.overalls this is a good tablet and i would suggest you buy it.update:if you have a choice between this or an apple product i would suggest apple. Nexus (google) doesnt have a place to go to if your  device breaks, but apple will give you store credit for a broken device. my tablet broke about 6 months after buying it, it might have been from the way i used it im not sure. The place where you insert a charger became to loose to hold a charger  and charge so unless held in a certain way it would ( rarely ) charge. i dont know if it would be hard to get a refund from this seller because i got it as a gift and i have no way of knowing where the person who gave it to me got it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device!
Reviews.Author: Georgi Dimitrov
Reviews.Content: Definitely a 5 star purchase.It's always in my pocket, ready for reading, surfing, navigation, media playing or gaming.The display is brilliant. The battery lasts exactly two days with normal usage.You will not regret if you buy one!

Reviews.Title: I'm loving this little tablet
Reviews.Author: jamurphy "jamurphy"
Reviews.Content: I received the 10 inch Kindle Fire HD for Christmas but never liked the platform so I exchanged it for the Nexus 7 and I've never regretted it. Oh sure, I can't stream Amazon Prime Movies like I could on the Kindle and I don't have Dolby Stereo but I can at least use Google Earth and a bunch of other apps that wouldn't work on the kindle fire hd.  The nexus is easier to use, more intuitive and I just like the presentation of the apps better with the small symbols rather than the enlarged kindergarten style of the 10 inch kindle fire HD.  the 7 inch size of the Nexus is more portable than the 10 inch  kindle and I can still see and read everything with ease.  The price is a definite plus compared to the iPad mini.  So what's NOT to like about the nexus 7?  I haven't found it yet.

Reviews.Title: Really good compared to iPad
Reviews.Author: R. Thomas "rthomas"
Reviews.Content: I had the iPad 2 but it was just little too big for me. So after doing a ton of research I decided to buy the nexus 7. This devise is fast responsive and works just as well as the ipad2. The display is very good and the program choices are on par for the most part with the ap store.I use google drive to back up important files but an expansion slot would be the one item I wish this had along with a rear camera.I am still happy with the product as this is much more portable then the iPad and the functionality is the same as the iPad but heck of a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: SteveC
Reviews.Content: Was delivered in two days, as ordered.I charged it up over night, and it only took a few minutes to power it up and get started getting familiar with it.The display is great for watching video and reading. I now have digital magazines through my local library, which read well on this device.I find myself spending quite a bit of time using this instead of my laptop for non productivity related use, but still need the laptop for getting some things done.All in all, a great birthday present to myself.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7 1B32 7-Inch 32 GB Tablet
Reviews.Author: Daggerrose "Daggerrose"
Reviews.Content: I really love it. This is an excellent product. Even with my big fingers on a 7" tablet I am 100% satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Me encantó
Reviews.Author: artevalexa
Reviews.Content: Muy buena imagen, muy buena calidad de video, y muy buen sonido, lo único que le faltó fue una cámara en el lado posterior de por lo menos 3mp, para competir en el mercado.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend...
Reviews.Author: G. Rivet "G @ Arabia"
Reviews.Content: Love this thing. It's small enough to fit in my lab coat at work and while not quite disposable, it's easier to replace than my ipad should I lose it or break it.

Reviews.Title: awesome device
Reviews.Author: Ahmed M.
Reviews.Content: This thing is great! Its very sleek and the perfect size for reading, watching videos, and playing games. The only con is that the battery life slightly decreases when on WiFi but I just turn it off after I'm done surfing.

Reviews.Title: Great Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: Mark Buckingham
Reviews.Content: The nexus line is really the standard for Android.  Because it's from google, everything works as the designers intended it.  You're not trapped in iTunes, you're not trapped in amazon's store.  You can do what you want with it.  On top of that, the hardware is fast, the software is very good, and the 7" form factor is ideal.There's only two things about it I can complain about...  (1) The screen on the kindle fire HD is better, as the colors are more vibrant. (2) The sound through the internal speakers is pretty weak, so you're going to want to use your earbuds.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Raymond W. Leung "rwleung98"
Reviews.Content: For the price it is the bet tablet. I would've paid more but since it is cheap I brought it. I love to read my bibles app. in bed and e-mails. I also now shop with it. I still rather type long e-mails or search on my desk top or lap top but for simple task it is geat. I can take it to the bathroom. All my magazines are collecting dust.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet - but ASUS Customer Service a cause for serious concern
Reviews.Author: T. Nemec "vsl2120"
Reviews.Content: Bought my Nexus 7 here on Amazon back in Sep, 2012 Towards the end on Jan 2012, it stopped charging. Searched the net and the ASUS site but none of the suggestions helped - no dirt in jack, usb tab not bent, none of 4 chargers or 4  cords worked. Finally issued an RMA by ASUS and instructed to send the unit to ASUS Service Center in Grapevine, Texas. Complied and my UPS Proof of Delivery shows ASUS receiving my tablet on Monday, Feb 4The ASUS site has a place to check the status of your RMA, but every time I enter my RMA, Serial # and phone, I'm told"Note: Due to our internal process, the repair status of your machine will be available the day after it has been delivered at the ASUS Service Center"Hmmm, the above message would indicate that I should start seeing status information on ...er...uh... Tuesday, Feb 5By the end of last week, I'm still led to believe that they have not recieved my unit (otherwise, I should be seeing status info). Sent several more requests asking for status. Finally, today I receive the following:Although the unit was delivered, information will not be available unless the unit was keyed-in for repair or service.Huh, they've had it nearly 2 weeks and have not decided whether to service or repair the unit? It is clearly under warranty. Apparently, and in direct contradiction to information provided to the end user, the availability of RMA status information has nothing whatsoever to do with when they actually received the machine from me.I responded:ASUS,I hope you can see just how frustrating your non-response would be to the average Nexus 7 owner.So it would appear that you received my Nexus 7 over 2 weeks ago.  Your web site that is supposed to provide status of my RMA actually provides no useful information at at all.  When I enter my RMA #, Serial # and phone, I'm told  "Note: Due to our internal process, the repair status of your machine will be available the day after it has been delivered at the ASUS Service Center"But wouldn't it have been much more accurate and honest to say:"Hi! We here at the ASUS Service Center may have had your machine for several weeks now... or not.  But, ignoring silly issues of where your machine may be located  right now , we can't give you any status information because, as it turns out, we only provide that information to customers once someone here decides to actually service or repair your machine.  Then, we have to find someone on our staff who still remembers how to key this information in. Assuming that person doesn't make any mistakes (hey! what can we say here, we are all human) it will be only 24 hours after that point that status information will be made available.  And, In your case, it appears that no decision has been made on whether to service or repair the unit. Gosh, I hope we remember where we stored it.So, please let me know if you would prefer I purchase a product from one of your competitors...FWIW, I suspect ASUS will eventually do the right thing - so I've only dinged them 1 star (out of 5 possible). It is a reasonably nice tablet - though it no longer stands out at the  head of the pack.

Reviews.Title: Small, Powerful, and looks good.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Does everything I expected it to do plus a bit.Plays videos beautifully, games look good and the interface is smooth.

Reviews.Title: Dead battery
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Peters
Reviews.Content: Battery dies very quickly even if tablet has not been used. I am constantly charging it and does not always respond to Internet or loses Internet connection easily

Reviews.Title: A great Buy
Reviews.Author: Lucas
Reviews.Content: This product was a steal. It arrived promptly and turned out to be everything I was hoping for. The easy-to-use design makes it one of the best android tablets out there, not to mention the easy access to all google products including latest OS releases.

Reviews.Title: First tablet
Reviews.Author: Poppy "Poppy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from a local Staples as my first tablet. I have had an iPhone since day 1 and am experienced with iOS, but for several reasons I was not interested in the iPad: mostly because of the price. So this was the best option.I did have to exchange my first Nexus 7 the day after purchasing, as I found a line of dead pixels and I knew it would bug me forever if I didn't get a new one. This kind of thing happens all the time, and the exchange process took about 2 minutes with 0 hassle.This was my first experience with Android anything, and at first it was confusing, but I picked it up very quickly and at this point I'm liking it more than iOS. It's fluid, user friendly, efficient, fun to use, and I have a little more control over everything.I'm not much of a movie watcher or game player - I use this tab for Skype, reading, browsing the internet, banking, paying bills, working (using Google Drive and Gmail constantly) and social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc). It does all of those things beautifully - I just wish more of my favorite apps were designed for tablets. Blown up phone apps looks pretty bad. But that problem is being fixed.Battery life seem solid. If you are only doing light browsing and emailing it will be good for at least 2 days, possibly more. We will see how it holds up.Fantastic value, great tablet. Might even go for the Nexus 10 later on down the road.

Reviews.Title: Works As Advertised
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Do your homework before making your purchase.  There are lots of tablets available, all with something just a little different to keep down costs and make them unique.  This tablet has most of you want - nice resolution graphics, most recent version of Andriod, not locked in to Amazon (like Kindle) or B&N; (like Nook), not even Google - but doesn't offer MHL to display the output on another device.  For me the 7" screen is fine for what I need.One other note:  be aware of potentially security exposures with Andriod OS.  Apps you download from Google Play or the Amazon App Store do not undergo the same rigor as apps available in iStore for Apple devices.  There are several Android apps that can access sensitive information on your Android device - things like on-line passwords, credit card numbers, etc.  I don't use my Nexus to do on-line shopping, on-line banking, etc.

Reviews.Title: excellent value
Reviews.Author: Chaz Palio
Reviews.Content: great tablet for the price point! have literally zero complaints, exceeds expectations :)battery life is much better than I thought it would be. Battery can easily last me all day with heavy usage

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Period
Reviews.Author: Riusaki
Reviews.Content: The best part about this tablet is how fast it is.  The Google Now feature alone is worth the price of admission.  I don't know how people can buy other tablets that are more expensive than this.  This is the best tablet ever made period.I give much credit to Amazon for introducing the Kindle Fire (which I also own) at such a low price point which has now spawned affordable tablets for the masses and without it we would not have the Nexus 7.If you are looking to see what Android is like this device will make you a believer.  Only thing to complete my Android arsenal is getting my hands on a Nexus 4.  Currently using a T-Mobile G2 (HTC Vision).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: RA
Reviews.Content: I managed to hold off on getting an iPad for years-I played around with my friends and while I liked them I just felt they were a little too big for what you get. As smaller tablets came out I still held off because they just seemed a little under powered and over priced...not so with the Nexus 7. After I got my mom an iPad mini I started shopping for a tablet in the 7" range and wow what a killer device. I'm not a small guy but even with my large hands some tablets are oversized in this size range (iPad mini is actually 7.9") and the Nexus 7 fits perfectly. Very flexible device, excellent display, CAPACITIVE touch screen, and solid build quality. I bought this on Amazon and 32 gigs of storage for under $300 is an amazing deal (equivalent iPad mini is $429!). Tip: root or jailbreak your phone (android or iPhone, respectively, and is 100% legal) and this thing works on the go with free tethering, must have.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Marques
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet, fast for games, easy to handle and lots of free apps with nice features.Bad things: no micro-SD card slot neither HDMI output (but it was expected due to the low price)

Reviews.Title: Well worth It!
Reviews.Author: Matthew McConnell
Reviews.Content: Product is a great value for the money.  All the specs of higher end models without the high end price tag.  We also received it within two days!

Reviews.Title: Problems too soon. Disappointed with seller.
Reviews.Author: jar
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my son on Christmas Day.  On January 5th, he began having problems with it powering up and down.  He contacted Google, who directed him to BuyBuy the Amazon seller.  BuyBuy wuld not except the return, saying it was over 30 days since date of purchase.  It was exactly 30 days from purchase, but not delivery.Before he began having problems, my son had been thrilled. We had a Kindle Fire in the past for almost two years before having any problems.

Reviews.Title: Display malfunction after less than 6-month of occasional usage
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Very nice display. However suddenly started to behave strangely, with the image jumping around and bleedings, then stabilized in a state where half the screen is pale, lacking intensity, and also some "bleeding" in that half part. I used it occasionally in a nice and thick leather cover. It never fell on the floor. I never hit it hard. It is just very weak I guess. And the display problem, categorized as LCD internal "cracks" problem is not covered by warranty as I was told by the retailer, who asked ASUS and co. Then it would cost ~90% of the price of a new one to repair. It is the end of the story for me with tablets, android and Google. My small light portable PC is so great in comparison (though cost 6X this tablet).

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Toni"
Reviews.Content: After much research, I decided that the Asus Nexus was the best choice for a tablet. Since this was my first tablet I looked forward to the day it would arrive.
