After much difficulty, Asus said the would honor the warranty and repair it.It was returned with the same problem - and of course, the warranty has now expired.No more Nexus/Asus for me.

Reviews.Title: WiFi issues
Reviews.Author: palmerdave
Reviews.Content: Won't stay connected to WiFi, tried all internet solutions including factory reset as recommended by Asus support. Same on 2 different networks.

Reviews.Title: cracked screen
Reviews.Author: Naseem Rakha
Reviews.Content: Two days ago the "return window" closed on this purchase -and guess what? The screen just cracked. We don't know why, but a quick search on the web tells us we are not alone. Seems these things like to spontaneously crack or shatter or whatever verb you want to use. We are waiting to hear from Amazon to see if they will be good business people and help out a disgruntled customer.....We shall see............

Reviews.Title: Many faults
Reviews.Author: Charles N. Hebert
Reviews.Content: The most glaring problem with this tablet is that it seldom will restart after "going to sleep."  It is hard to turn the thing off to recycle it.  I have two other tablets, both Samsung Galaxy 2 10.1, and they work beautifully.  I live in Panama and repairs are out of the question. I wouldn't pay $2.49 for another Asus Google Nexus tablet of any size.

Reviews.Title: expensive
Reviews.Author: Baozhu Yang
Reviews.Content: It is pretty good, while the price is down after I got it. I should wait for few days or look other stores.

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied by unfair refund policy
Reviews.Author: timobell
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Nexus 7 from Adorama through Amazon as a birthday gift for my wife. My wife did not even turn on the tablet because she said the 7-inch screen would be too small for her, so I called Adorama to try to exchange it for a 10-inch screen Nexus. Adorama says that since the order was placed through Amazon, they could not exchange it. Only option was to return the tablet and they would determine a "restocking fee" to charge me. Adorama could not even give a range of what the restocking fee would be. This has left me in a difficult situation with my wife who insists on getting a 10-inch screen because she has poor vision and needs a larger screen. I have ordered many items from Adorama in the past but will not order anything from Adorama again.

Reviews.Title: The worst product ever made!!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Diaz
Reviews.Content: - Nexus 7 will not turn on.... Hold down the Power button for a full 30 seconds: realy!!! OMG- Lag, reboots issues any time... is fustrating- Touchscreen is not responsive!!!!- Unvaluable piece of "#$%&is the worst buy in my life....the best way of wasting so much technology in one package...that's why Apple is Apple and other companies will copy onlyIf true, I lost $ 260 to $ 440 plus the mini ipad I have to buy nowNo one in my family wants this thing, even my 2 year old daughter

Reviews.Title: Thin
Reviews.Author: Paula A. Sillas "paulaspoochplace"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this when I ordered my other rugs ight stand but it the color matches really good to our bathroom

Reviews.Title: I'm very disappointed with this item
Reviews.Author: Leon Prepago
Reviews.Content: i bought this tablet, and from the moment  that I tried to turn it on it had some issue ... luckly one of my friend solved the problem by doing something to the battery , but even though it is working now  that doesn't mean that  I'm not mad about that. that's why i give you this bad grade.

Reviews.Title: Asus is Excellent, but you become Google's Captive
Reviews.Author: M. Degani "The Skeptic"
Reviews.Content: The product itself is very good, and I can say the same about all Asus products I have experienced so far.HOWEVER, THERE IS A CATCH.The catch is that you might, as well, renounce your Privacy for good. Because, by purchasing any Google product such as this one, you become a slave to Google's whims. You MUST open your whole life to their prying eyes and to whatever they do with your private information and with their knowledge of your private life.In case you have already made the mistake of buying an Android system, one thing I highly recommend is to never logon to your bank or broker or to whatever else you want to keep to yourself.As important, when you buy applications from their internet store, they have the power to control your usage of that application. Specifcally, I purchased Poweramp and then discovered that it doesn't work when I have no Internet connection (let's say I want to listen to my music when I am in the Mojave Desert). That way, they keep you tethered to them via the Internet at all times.My bottom line is that I will never again purchase anything from a company that has two g's and two o's in their name.

Reviews.Title: love my Nexus
Reviews.Author: kelliej
Reviews.Content: I've only had one time when my Nexus wouldn't turn on~hubby opened it..against the "rules"? but its perfect now, works great. I love it. 32 GB, nothing negative to say. Love that it doesn't require ITunes to  download any music, apps,etc. DISLIKE ITunes. Using Google was one of the major selling points for me.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7 - 2 stars
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Its not what I thought it would be and it doesn't meet my expectations - is it possible to return it for something else

Reviews.Title: nnot for rookie
Reviews.Author: jerry yax
Reviews.Content: hard to figure out does not come ready to use will have to get tech just to set it up

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mark Weiss
Reviews.Content: It is the second one we have bought and we love them because they are 14 the price of ipad and works just as well.

Reviews.Title: Hated it with a passion in the first 3 minutes
Reviews.Author: 150 F3
Reviews.Content: It doesn't respond to user input. When a user presses a finger directly on a web link, something should happen. Not nothing. Not shrinking the browser and sliding it to the right. No. Just loading the desired page the link is linked to. Nothing else. Simple web browsing activity. Not forcing the user to press and press and press more than 20 times with no results. The device is unusable.The bezel is huge. The screen is small. This is not desirable. I would prefer a large screen with room for displaying information.The keyboard feature is incredibly odd and difficult to use. Numbers and special characters are not visible, so the user must activate the other two keyboard modes. This is less usable than a standard PC keyboard. I saw no USB port for attaching a standard keyboard. I would hate to write on this device. It is not usable.I wished to log in to my flickr account. My password uses uppercase and lowercase letters. It uses numbers and symbols. It was quite difficult to enter the password with this device's hard to use keyboard. I prefer separate concave keys with permanent markings on them. Unlike flat screens, they offer physical feedback instead of nothing. I have never enjoyed touch screens, and this device confirmed my burning hatred of that weak, pathetic technology.I wished to view my flickr photostream as a slide show to test the screen's picture quality. It was impossible. The device did not support Adobe Flash. The device is completely useless for web browsing without Adobe Flash. I wanted pictures, not an error message and a link to download the Flash player that led to another error message. How can a 21st century web browsing device not support Flash? It is ubiquitous and essential. The device is truly useless.I thought Google Chrome had Flash built in. Evidently I was mistaken. The Android version of Chrome is different and far weaker than the Linux and Windows version. What is the purpose of this operating system, browser, and device? How does not supporting Flash help users wishing to view Flash content?I hate this device. It does not serve my simple needs. A 10 year old desktop PC is more than capable of easily accepting alphanumeric input efficiently, responding to input from pointing devices, and running Adobe Flash in a web browser. The Nexus 7 is garbage. I will avoid all ASUS and Google products from now on.

Reviews.Title: dissapointed :(
Reviews.Author: Yelena cuentas
Reviews.Content: My nexus won't start up, i don't use it, because when i open de box the nexus never turn on. i charge de batterie as the manual say, but don't start up. dissapointed :( .... the seller or amazon doesn't worried for my problem. i lost 271$ and no one take the responsability, or any answer

Reviews.Title: Some impressive things but the iPad is better.
Reviews.Author: J. Putman
Reviews.Content: I am a gadget nut and was really excited about the specs and price of this device.  I like Asus products and was ready for a change after my first generation iPad is not really supported by Apple anymore.  After using this device for a few days I'm really missing the polish of the iPad experience.  The browser has had more compatibility problems than I ever saw on an iPad, the android purchase system is chaotic. The whole Android experience is almost as clunky as dealing with Microsoft products.  Sometimes it knows my google login info, sometimes it doesn't.  Google video says I paid $14 for a video that I don't remember agreeing to buy.  Clunky... Lots more ad driven apps, browser stutter, so-so battery life. The iPad browser double tap text resizing works better.There are a few things I'm learning to like.  The wifi analyzer software in is cool, and, unlike the Apple iPad, they were kind enough to build a decent alarm clock into the tablet.  So I'll probably be ok long term with this device, but my fingers are crossed that they improve the OS a bit more.  The learning curve on the iPad was not as steep.

Reviews.Title: 'Ted' is Awful
Reviews.Author: larry e smith
Reviews.Content: Prelude makes it appear to be a PG movie.  au contraire. Foul language consistent with people of limited vocabulary and values.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE WIFI
Reviews.Author: m balie
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product on the google play store because amazon was out of stock. Big mistake. When it arrived the wifi was so week that it was not usable in our house. We compared with our iPad and signal was perfect. Also predictive writing is a disaster, it is very difficult to type an email. When I called to return it to google I was charged 15pct restocking even though the item simply does not work. I understand this if I just changed my mind and the packaging was open but certainly not for a defective item. Beware!

Reviews.Title: Hold off on your purchase
Reviews.Author: Ann Geiger
Reviews.Content: Hold off on purchasing this device if you plan to connect anything to it via Bluetooth.  Apparently the latest Android upgrade (4.2.1) has a bug that makes Bluetooth inoperable for at least some people.  I could, but not longer can, connect my keyboard, phone and earpiece.  Google technical support can only say they are aware of the problem and working on it.

Reviews.Title: if it fails, throw it away
Reviews.Author: richard warner
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet.  Fast graphics, long battery life.However...  This is an ASUS, which means less than perfect quality assurance and no repair capability.Which means if it breaks there is no way to get it fixed.If you get a working one you will like it, if you get a bad one throw it away and buy an Apple or some other brand than offers a real warranty.Update:ok, not a fair reviewThe product itself is very nice, recommend the skin to protect it.  One star lost because of the camera - for me a backside camera would make more sense than a front side.  Not being to shoot at least as well as a phone defeats the purpose.  It is possible to shoot "blind" with the front side camera, not fun, just possible.  People who Skype will love it I have heard from several including tech naive friends.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: It will break and be useless - don't buy this!!! Not worth $1.00
Reviews.Author: JRR
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Screen breaks after being dropped at almost any height, even when contained in padded casing.My experience: tablet was in a padded coat pocket which fell off a 1 1/2 foot counter onto a hard wood floor. The screen had "spider" cracks across it and was totally unusable. Asus quoted me $165.00 to fix this tablet, which originally cost $199.00. You cannot use this tablet AT ALL when the screen has been cracked - IT"S A 100% LEMON!!!The Nexus is great, until it breaks, and unless you live in a padded room and never raise this device above 1 foot off any surface, it will breakDON"T BUY DEFECTIVE PRODUCTS LIKE THIS! YOU WILL WASTE YOUR $$$Amazon should stop selling this tablet until Asus fixes this defective screenDO NOT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: Sloppy
Reviews.Author: Pearl1213
Reviews.Content: I bought this device for my wife who hogs my iPad.  I read the reviews in Amazon, concentrating on the poor ones.  I just assumed the quality control problems noted in early reviews had been addressed and choose a five star vendor.Upon receipt of device, I immediately plugged it in to charge it up the battery overnight.  The next morning I turned it on and familiarized myself with screen layout, buttons and, of course, read the instruction booklet.  I uploaded a couple of thousand of JPGS that I knew my wife would want.  I set up a few apps she uses (Kindle, Facebook, etc) and logged on into her accounts.  At this point, all was happy with the world.After about four hours of use, she brought the device to me, saying it would not turn on.  Since she is technologically challenged, I ignored her, assuming it just needed charging up.  So I plugged it in for six hours but nada.  I checked to see if the outlet has power and it did.  So I plugged the device's USB end of the charger into my desktop computer - again nada.  Nor can I see the Nexus in Windows Explorer.  It is just dead.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing purchase
Reviews.Author: Zebull
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Nexus 7 for a couple months now and I wish I could return it.  It is defined by what it can't do rather than what it can.  You can: read books and play games on it, just like every other tablet out there.  You can't: play Flash files, play digital copies of movies you've purchased, use the GPS for anything useful except when you're connected to the internet.  (This last one is a particular sore spot, since the GPS was the reason I chose it over the Amazon Fire.  - it says you can download maps to "use" offline.  And you can download maps, but you can't use them for anything useful.  It's basically a picture of the map - no search, no directions, nothing)  What else can't you do with the Nexus 7?  You can't use it to watch Amazon Prime videos even though you're an Amazon Prime customer.  You can't use it as a universal remote.  You CAN play music, but the built in speakers remind me of a transistor radio, so playing Pandora on it while cleaning out the garage is a nostalgic trip back to the 70's.  It has neither deep nor rich sound.I've gone online and it seems like there's various workarounds for some of these issues.  And certainly other tablets have speaker issues.  And it's Jelly Beans fault about the Flash files, etc, etc.  In the end, this tablet simply doesn't do much.

Reviews.Title: this tablet is very irritating if you previously used an Apple product
Reviews.Author: R. Vorobieva
Reviews.Content: My husband got this one for me instead if mini IPad. I can't be more unhappier dealing with it for 2 months.What a user unfriendly and irritating thing! I thought at first - it was a just a learning curve,  but uneasiness of using it doesn't go away.I am buying my mini iPad this month.UpdateI got my mini IPad a month ago and am extremely happy with it.  As a working mom of two I have no desire to spend my energy on constantly figuring out the settings and weird features that I don't need.

Reviews.Title: Sorely Disappointed to Extremely Happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just received my Nexus 7 32g yesterday.  After being on the charger all night the battery was still not charged. Was able to start it up attached to the a/c adapter.  The tools did not reconized the battery and kept telling me to plug in the adapter even though it was plugged in. Gave it a few more hours on the charger and decided to check it.  System wouldn't start up, kept getting black screen with static nothing else.  I should have just saved my money or bought the Kindle Fire.  My friend has no problems with that.  Sorry Amazon, I'll never doubt you again.****Update****Received my replacement and now I understand what all the fuss was about. This thing is blazing fast. The clarity is awesome and best of all it charges. I will have to change my rating. Even though this started out as bad experience, the customer service and the new working product has more that made up for it. After using it for a week, I can honestly say that this exceeds most of my expectations. It does have a quirk that you might want to keep in mind. To use the built in camera, you will have to download an app from google play to find the app on Nexus. Yes, you read that correctly. There is no visible link to the camera app on the Nexus 7. This doesn't really bother me because I did not purchase it for the camera. So for me it is nothing more than a slight inconvenience.  The speaker quality is not that great but improves with the use of headphones.

Reviews.Title: Stop working on second day
Reviews.Author: vlad
Reviews.Content: Purchase Nexus 7 from Amazon. I had some problem to dounload Real Player and on the second day I can not switch it on. Big diapointment.

ProductInfo.Features:
Android 4.1 Jelly Bean, 7 inches Display
NVIDIA Tegra 3.0 1.2 GHz
32 GB Flash Memory, 1 GB RAM Memory
SD Card slot unavailable
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS Google Nexus 7 Tablet (7-Inch, 32GB) 2012 Model
